speaker: Oath on the Sand
lines: After the bell, the crowd exhales; the day puts itself away.
You kneel and press your hand into the sand; it keeps your print and your promise.
You swear to fight only what deserves it, and to be what the cheering thinks you are when it is kind.
The arena listens. It has heard worse. It chooses to believe you.
A runner brings a bundle wrapped in old banners.
Inside: a weapon with the grit of glass and the grace of rain.
The promoter nods once, like a man who lost a bet and doesn't mind.
The medic smiles twice, like a person who knows stories that end later.

give_item.name: Arena Edge
give_item.description: A blade tempered by cheers and stubbornness
